explanation: enough, or more than enough
sentence: She's had ample time to get the work done.
sentence_gap: She's had _____ time to get the work done.

explanation: literary; a sign of what might happen in the future
sentence: These sales figures are a good augury for another profitable year.
sentence_gap: These sales figures are a good ______ for another profitable year.

explanation: (of people) kind and gentle; not hurting anyone
sentence: You would never have guessed his intentions from the benign expression on his face.
sentence_gap: You would never have guessed his intentions from the ______ expression on his face.

explanation: a two-wheeled vehicle that was used in ancient times for racing and fighting and was pulled by a horse or horses
sentence: His enemies were men of the early iron age, and used the chariot in war.
sentence_gap: His enemies were men of the early iron age, and used the _______ in war.

explanation: a group, especially of trees or flowers
sentence: They hiked around a clump of cedar and then they were there.
sentence_gap: They hiked around a _____ of cedar and then they were there.

explanation: happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special
sentence: Electric cars are increasingly commonplace.
sentence_gap: Electric cars are increasingly ___________.

explanation: to bend your knees and lower yourself so that you are close to the ground and leaning forward slightly
sentence: I crouched behind the chair to avoid being seen.
sentence_gap: I ________ behind the chair to avoid being seen.

explanation: done on purpose rather than by accident
sentence: The speech was a deliberate attempt to embarrass the government.
sentence_gap: The speech was a __________ attempt to embarrass the government.

explanation: to damage or show no respect towards something holy or very much respected
sentence: It's a crime to desecrate the country's flag.
sentence_gap: It's a crime to _________ the country's flag.

explanation: embarrassment and the loss of other people's respect, or behavior that causes this
sentence: He brought disgrace on the whole team by falsifying the results.
sentence_gap: He brought ________ on the whole team by falsifying the results.

explanation: formal; special permission, especially from the Church, to do something that is not usually allowed
sentence: She needed a special dispensation to remarry.
sentence_gap: She needed a special ____________ to remarry.

explanation: looking the same in every part, usually in a way that most people consider to be boring
sentence: The countryside is flat and featureless.
sentence_gap: The countryside is flat and ___________.

sentence: The forests are chiefly composed of oak, fir, pine, ash and alder.
sentence_gap: The forests are chiefly composed of oak, ___, pine, ash and alder.

explanation: feeling that everything is moving and that you are going to fall
sentence: When I looked down from the top floor, I felt giddy.
sentence_gap: When I looked down from the top floor, I felt _____.

explanation: to obtain information, knowledge, etc., sometimes with difficulty and often from various different places
sentence: These figures were gleaned from a number of studies.
sentence_gap: These figures were _______ from a number of studies.

explanation: to feel or express great pleasure or satisfaction because of your own success or good luck, or someone else's failure or bad luck
sentence: His enemies were quick to gloat at his humiliation.
sentence_gap: His enemies were quick to _____ at his humiliation.

explanation: sticky
sentence: Short-grain rice turns into a soft, glutinous mass when cooked.
sentence_gap: Short-grain rice turns into a soft, _________ mass when cooked.

explanation: a feeling of anger or dislike toward someone because of something bad they have done to you in the past
sentence: He is not the type of person to bear a grudge against anyone.
sentence_gap: He is not the type of person to bear a ______ against anyone.

explanation: (of a person's voice) low and unfriendly, or (of a person's behavior) unfriendly or showing no patience
sentence: "Yeah, so what?" came the gruff reply.
sentence_gap: "Yeah, so what?" came the _____ reply.

explanation: looking very tired because of illness, worry, or a lack of sleep
sentence: He'd been drinking the night before and was looking a bit haggard.
sentence_gap: He'd been drinking the night before and was looking a bit _______.

explanation: to sing a tune with your lips closed
sentence: She was humming softly to herself.
sentence_gap: She was _______ softly to herself.

explanation: formal; not good or honest; that should make you feel shame
sentence: The character of the first Medician pope shows a peculiar mixture of noble and ignoble qualities.
sentence_gap: The character of the first Medician pope shows a peculiar mixture of noble and _______ qualities.

explanation: to make someone feel that they must do something
sentence: I wonder what it is that impels him to exercise all the time.
sentence_gap: I wonder what it is that ______ him to exercise all the time.

explanation: impossible to avoid
sentence: Some assumption had to be made in these cases, however, and this one seemed ineluctable.
sentence_gap: Some assumption had to be made in these cases, however, and this one seemed ___________.

explanation: formal; a particular point in time
sentence: At this juncture, it is impossible to say whether she will make a full recovery.
sentence_gap: At this ________, it is impossible to say whether she will make a full recovery.

explanation: a small object that someone gives you so that you will remember them
sentence: My aunt gave me one of her brooches as a keepsake.
sentence_gap: My aunt gave me one of her brooches as a ________.

explanation: to press something, especially a mixture for making bread, firmly and repeatedly with the hands and fingers
sentence: Knead the dough until smooth.
sentence_gap: _____ the dough until smooth.

explanation: (of plants, gardens, etc.) growing thickly and strongly in a way that is attractive; covered in healthy grass and plants
sentence: The lake, with its lush scenery, is a favorite with canoeists.
sentence_gap: The lake, with its ____ scenery, is a favorite with canoeists.

sentence: The manatee's flippers, which bear nails, are also used to embrace and touch other manatees.
sentence_gap: The _______'s flippers, which bear nails, are also used to embrace and touch other _______s.

explanation: a sweet alcoholic drink made from honey and water, drunk especially in the past
sentence: In those times they were wise people, who realised how good mead was.
sentence_gap: In those times they were wise people, who realised how good ____ was.

explanation: disapproving; (of people) enjoying getting involved in situations that do not concern them
sentence: It is a meddlesome, bureaucratic and wrong-headed programme.
sentence_gap: It is a __________, bureaucratic and wrong-headed programme.

explanation: great suffering of the mind or body
sentence: Fame brought her nothing but misery.
sentence_gap: Fame brought her nothing but ______.

explanation: an opening or hole, especially one in the body, such as the mouth
sentence: I was stuffing cake into every available orifice.
sentence_gap: I was stuffing cake into every available _______.

explanation: unwilling to change your opinion about something, in a way that other people think is annoying and unreasonable
sentence: Why are you being so pigheaded about this?
sentence_gap: Why are you being so _________ about this?

explanation: to steal, especially during a war
sentence: Many of the region's churches had been plundered.
sentence_gap: Many of the region's churches had been _________.

explanation: formal; a lack of the basic things that are necessary for an acceptable standard of living
sentence: Economic privation is pushing the poor towards crime.
sentence_gap: Economic _________ is pushing the poor towards crime.

explanation: literary; an influence that is not human in origin and is thought to control people's lives
sentence: She believed her suffering was sent by providence.
sentence_gap: She believed her suffering was sent by __________.

explanation: a small dog with a flat face and a short, wide nose
sentence: Pugs have many wrinkles in their faces, so owners will often clean inside the creases to avoid irritation and infection.
sentence_gap: ____ have many wrinkles in their faces, so owners will often clean inside the creases to avoid irritation and infection.

explanation: (of people or animals) to move through a place in a group, usually breaking things and causing damage
sentence: Several thousand demonstrators rampaged through the center of the city.
sentence_gap: Several thousand demonstrators ________ through the center of the city.

explanation: formal; necessary or needed for a particular purpose
sentence: He lacked the requisite skills for the job.
sentence_gap: He lacked the _________ skills for the job.

explanation: a long, narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration
sentence: He tied up the present with ribbon.
sentence_gap: He tied up the present with ______.

explanation: formal; most important or noticeable
sentence: The article presented the salient facts of the dispute clearly and concisely.
sentence_gap: The article presented the _______ facts of the dispute clearly and concisely.

explanation: to burn the skin with boiling liquid or steam
sentence: I dropped a pan of boiling water and scalded my leg.
sentence_gap: I dropped a pan of boiling water and _______ my leg.

explanation: a decorated rod carried by a king or queen at ceremonies as a symbol of their power
sentence: They are the oldest surviving regalia in Britain and consist of a crown, a sword and a scepter.
sentence_gap: They are the oldest surviving regalia in Britain and consist of a crown, a sword and a _______.

explanation: formal; the state of being under the control of someone else and of having no freedom
sentence: In the past, the majority of women were consigned to a lifetime of servitude and poverty.
sentence_gap: In the past, the majority of women were consigned to a lifetime of _________ and poverty.

explanation: formal; the act of ending a connection, relationship, etc. or of being separated from a person, place, etc.
sentence: The minister announced the severance of aid to the country. The hardest thing to cope with was the severance from his family.
sentence_gap: The minister announced the _________ of aid to the country. The hardest thing to cope with was the _________ from his family.

sentence: The children took their pails and shovels to the beach.
sentence_gap: The children took their pails and _______ to the beach.

explanation: a large plant that is smaller than a tree and that has several stems of wood coming from the ground
sentence: She planted some roses and other flowering shrubs.
sentence_gap: She planted some roses and other flowering ______.

explanation: to walk towards or away from someone, trying not to be noticed
sentence: She sidled past him, pretending that she had not seen him.
sentence_gap: She ______ past him, pretending that she had not seen him.

explanation: formal; the quality of being strange
sentence: He has been behaving with great singularity.
sentence_gap: He has been behaving with great ___________.

explanation: formal; a very small, thin piece of something, usually broken off something larger
sentence: The glass smashed into slivers.
sentence_gap: The glass smashed into _______.

explanation: to cry slightly in a way that is weak and does not make other people feel sympathy for you
sentence: He's sitting in his bedroom snivelling because he was told off for not doing his homework.
sentence_gap: He's sitting in his bedroom __________ because he was told off for not doing his homework.

explanation: liquid produced in the mouth to keep the mouth wet and to help to prepare food to be digested
sentence: He wiped some spittle from his mouth.
sentence_gap: He wiped some _______ from his mouth.

explanation: to spread the arms and legs out carelessly and untidily while sitting or lying down
sentence: He was sprawling in an armchair in front of the TV.
sentence_gap: He was _________ in an armchair in front of the TV.

explanation: (of plants or seeds) to produce new leaves or buds; to start to grow
sentence: The seeds will sprout in a few days.
sentence_gap: The seeds will ______ in a few days.

explanation: to encourage an activity or development or make it happen faster
sentence: Rising consumer sales have the effect of spurring the economy to faster growth.
sentence_gap: Rising consumer sales have the effect of ________ the economy to faster growth.

sentence: Brody was locked in a padded cell and forced to wear a straitjacket.
sentence_gap: Brody was locked in a padded cell and forced to wear a ____________.

explanation: to arrange the different parts of something in separate layers or groups
sentence: The sample of people questioned was drawn from the university's student register and stratified by age and gender.
sentence_gap: The sample of people questioned was drawn from the university's student register and __________ by age and gender.

explanation: (especially of a man) confident, elegant, and polite, sometimes in a way that does not seem sincere
sentence: The manager was suave and sophisticated.
sentence_gap: The manager was _____ and sophisticated.

explanation: leather that is slightly rough to touch and is not shiny
sentence: She decided to wear her brown suede shoes.
sentence_gap: She decided to wear her brown _____ shoes.

explanation: easily influenced or harmed by something
sentence: She isn't very susceptible to flattery.
sentence_gap: She isn't very ___________ to flattery.

explanation: a drink made with strong alcohol, sugar, hot water, and sometimes spices
sentence: After the swim in the icy water we all had a hot toddy to warm us up.
sentence_gap: After the swim in the icy water we all had a hot _____ to warm us up.

sentence: The main orchestral brass instruments are the horn, trumpet, trombone, and tuba.
sentence_gap: The main orchestral brass instruments are the horn, trumpet, ________, and tuba.

explanation: not controlled and therefore extreme
sentence: A dog should have an unbridled passion for food.
sentence_gap: A dog should have an _________ passion for food.

explanation: formal; happening too soon or sooner than is normal or expected
sentence: She met a tragic and untimely death at 25.
sentence_gap: She met a tragic and ________ death at 25.

explanation: literary; a view, especially a beautiful view from a high position
sentence: After a hard climb, we were rewarded by a picture-postcard vista of rolling hills under a deep blue summer sky.
sentence_gap: After a hard climb, we were rewarded by a picture-postcard _____ of rolling hills under a deep blue summer sky.

explanation: an empty area of land, especially in or near a city, that is not used to grow crops or built on, or used in any way
sentence: The car was dumped in a stretch of wasteland in the south of the city.
sentence_gap: The car was dumped in a stretch of _________ in the south of the city.

explanation: very tired, especially after you have been working hard or doing something for a long time
sentence: I think he's a little weary after his long journey.
sentence_gap: I think he's a little _____ after his long journey.

explanation: an area like a wide wall built near the edge of the sea or a river where ships can be tied and goods can be taken off them
sentence: The crates were unloaded onto the wharf.
sentence_gap: The crates were unloaded onto the _____.

explanation: to make large twisting movements with the body
sentence: The pain was so unbearable that he was writhing in agony.
sentence_gap: The pain was so unbearable that he was ________ in agony.
